Body:
Forgive me if this is not the right sort of question to post here, but I was curious as to the derivation of the above sentence. (Apparently the correct choice is 'we'). 

Their class has more singers than we [have singers]

or

Their class has more singers than we [ do [have singers] ]

where [] denotes Ellipsis?
Title: Their class has more singers than (we/us) -- possible syntactical derivations?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
